node.title: One new COVID-19 case in SA as doctors' union calls for pause on arrivals
node.alt: A woman with short brown hair
node.description: South Australia records one new COVID-19 case, in an interstate traveller, as the AMA state president calls for a stop to interstate and international arrivals while more information is gathered about the Omicron variant.
node.content:
["South Australia has recorded one new COVID-19 case, in an interstate traveller.", "The woman in her 20s is the 10th new case since the state opened its borders to NSW, Victoria and the ACT last Tuesday.", "No exposure sites have been announced connected with the case.", "There are now seven active COVID-19 cases in South Australia.", "SA Health has also announced it is changing how it reports the state's vaccination rate.", "It will now report on the population 12 and over that is vaccinated, since that metric is being used for the next round of restrictions being eased \u2014 expected in late December.", "", "
About 18,000 travellers have entered South Australia over the past week.(ABC News)
", "The COVID-Ready plan released in October cites a 90 per cent vaccination rate among those 12 and over as the point at which international travellers can come without quarantining.", "As of today, 79.1 per cent of South Australian residents 12 and over have received two COVID-19 vaccination doses, while 88.5 per cent have received at least one.", "The state's population has also been revised down by 9,000 to reflect a lack of international students.", "
Call for SA borders to shut again\u00a0
", "The Australian Medical Association's South Australian branch president has called for the state's borders to be shut once more with the new Omicron variant of COVID now in the country.", "A national cabinet meeting has been called for tomorrow with state and territory leaders to discuss the situation.", "AMA SA president Michelle Atchison said little was yet known about the new variant and it was unknown how dangerous it was.", "\"One of the ways for managing all of this is to press pause on international and interstate travellers coming to South Australia and press pause on our borders at the moment, just while we gather some information about Omicron, how much we need to be concerned about that and whether we need to make any more restrictions in place for Omicron here in South Australia,\" Dr Atchison said.", "Premier Steven Marshall said some changes had already been made to controls, including the reintroduction of 14 days' quarantine for international arrivals.", "\"Now I'm very hopeful that the severity of this new variant is no higher; I'm hoping that it's lower than the Delta variant,\" he said.", "\"We do know though that it is highly transmissible, so tomorrow we will get more information.", "\"I am hopeful that we can stick to our normal timetable, but we do need to listen to the experts.\"", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
